channel.title: CVE Feed for Rockwell Automation -- FactoryTalk View SE
channel.description: The latest CVEs for Rockwell Automation -- FactoryTalk View SE

item.title: CVE-2020-14480|2024-08-04T12:46:34.603Z -- rockwell%20automation -- factorytalk%20view%20se
item.description: Due to usernames/passwords being stored in plaintext in Random Access Memory (RAM), a local, authenticated attacker could gain access to certain credentials, including Windows Logon credentials.

item.title: CVE-2020-12027|2024-08-04T11:48:57.890Z -- rockwell%20automation -- factorytalk%20view%20se
item.description: All versions of FactoryTalk View SE disclose the hostnames and file paths for certain files within the system. A remote, authenticated attacker may be able to leverage this information for reconnaissance efforts. Rockwell Automation recommends enabling built in security features found within FactoryTalk View SE. Users should follow guidance found in knowledge base articles 109056 and 1126943 to set up IPSec and/or HTTPs.

item.title: CVE-2020-14481|2024-08-04T12:46:34.655Z -- rockwell%20automation -- factorytalk%20view%20se
item.description: The DeskLock tool provided with FactoryTalk View SE uses a weak encryption algorithm that may allow a local, authenticated attacker to decipher user credentials, including the Windows user or Windows DeskLock passwords. If the compromised user has an administrative account, an attacker could gain full access to the user’s operating system and certain components of FactoryTalk View SE.

item.title: CVE-2020-12029|2024-08-04T11:48:57.742Z -- rockwell%20automation -- factorytalk%20view%20se
item.description: All versions of FactoryTalk View SE do not properly validate input of filenames within a project directory. A remote, unauthenticated attacker may be able to execute a crafted file on a remote endpoint that may result in remote code execution (RCE). Rockwell Automation recommends applying patch 1126289. Before installing this patch, the patch rollup dated 06 Apr 2020 or later MUST be applied. 1066644 – Patch Roll-up for CPR9 SRx.

item.title: CVE-2020-12028|2024-08-04T11:48:57.703Z -- rockwell%20automation -- factorytalk%20view%20se
item.description: In all versions of FactoryTalk View SEA remote, an authenticated attacker may be able to utilize certain handlers to interact with the data on the remote endpoint since those handlers do not enforce appropriate permissions. Rockwell Automation recommends enabling built in security features found within FactoryTalk View SE. Users should follow guidance found in knowledge base articles 109056 and 1126943 to set up IPSec and/or HTTPs.

item.title: CVE-2020-12031|2024-08-04T11:48:58.015Z -- rockwell%20automation -- factorytalk%20view%20se
item.description: In all versions of FactoryTalk View SE, after bypassing memory corruption mechanisms found in the operating system, a local, authenticated attacker may corrupt the associated memory space allowing for arbitrary code execution. Rockwell Automation recommends applying patch 1126290. Before installing this patch, the patch rollup dated 06 Apr 2020 or later MUST be applied. 1066644 – Patch Roll-up for CPR9 SRx.
